identification.referenceAbsoluteOrbitNumber: Absolute orbit number for the reference RSLC
identification.secondaryAbsoluteOrbitNumber: Absolute orbit number for the secondary RSLC
identification.referenceIsJointObservation: "True" if any portion of the reference RSLC was acquired in a joint observation mode (e.g., L-band and S-band simultaneously), "False" otherwise
identification.secondaryIsJointObservation: "True" if any portion of the secondary RSLC was acquired in a joint observation mode (e.g., L-band and S-band simultaneously), "False" otherwise
identification.productDoi: Digital Object Identifier (DOI) for the product
identification.productVersion: Product version which represents the structure of the product and the science content governed by the algorithm, input data, and processing parameters
identification.productSpecificationVersion: Product specification version which represents the schema of this product
identification.referenceZeroDopplerStartTime: Azimuth start time (in UTC) of reference RSLC product in the format YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.sssssssss
identification.referenceZeroDopplerEndTime: Azimuth stop time (in UTC) of reference RSLC product in the format YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.sssssssss
identification.secondaryZeroDopplerStartTime: Azimuth start time (in UTC) of secondary RSLC product in the format YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.sssssssss
identification.secondaryZeroDopplerEndTime: Azimuth stop time (in UTC) of secondary RSLC product in the format YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.sssssssss
identification.referencePlannedDatatakeId: List of planned datatakes included in the reference RSLC
identification.secondaryPlannedDatatakeId: List of planned datatakes included in the secondary RSLC
identification.referencePlannedObservationId: List of planned observations included in the reference RSLC
identification.secondaryPlannedObservationId: List of planned observations included in the secondary RSLC
identification.referenceListOfObservationModes: List of observation modes of the L0B granules used to generate the reference RSLC (one mode per L0B)
identification.secondaryListOfObservationModes: List of observation modes of the L0B granules used to generate the secondary RSLC (one mode per L0B)
identification.isUrgentObservation: Flag indicating if observation is nominal ("False") or urgent ("True")
identification.listOfFrequencies: List of frequency layers available in the product
identification.diagnosticModeFlag: Indicates if the radar operation mode is a diagnostic mode (1-2) or DBFed science (0): 0, 1, or 2
identification.productLevel: Product level. "L0A": Unprocessed instrument data; "L0B": Reformatted, unprocessed instrument data; "L1": Processed instrument data in radar coordinates system; and "L2": Processed instrument data in geocoded coordinates system
identification.isGeocoded: Flag to indicate if the product data is in the radar geometry ("False") or in the map geometry ("True")
identification.boundingPolygon: OGR compatible WKT representing the bounding polygon of the image. Horizontal coordinates are WGS84 longitude followed by latitude (both in degrees), and the vertical coordinate is the height above the WGS84 ellipsoid in meters. The first point corresponds to the start-time, near-range radar coordinate, and the perimeter is traversed in counterclockwise order on the map. This means the traversal order in radar coordinates differs for left-looking and right-looking sensors. The polygon includes the four corners of the radar grid, with equal numbers of points distributed evenly in radar coordinates along each edge
identification.processingDateTime: Processing date and time (in UTC) in the format YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS
identification.platformName: Name of the platform used to collect the remote sensing data provided in this product
identification.instrumentName: Name of the instrument used to collect the remote sensing data provided in this product
identification.processingType: Processing pipeline used to generate this granule. "Nominal": standard production system; "Urgent": time-sensitive processing in response to urgent response events; "Custom": user-initiated processing outside the nominal production system
identification.isDithered: "True" if the pulse timing was varied (dithered) during acquisition, "False" otherwise
identification.isMixedMode: "True" if this product is generated from reference and secondary RSLCs with different range bandwidths, "False" otherwise
identification.compositeReleaseId: Unique version identifier of the science data production system
identification.isFullFrame: "True" if the product fully covers a NISAR frame, "False" if partial coverage

identification.staticLayersDataAccess: Location of the static layers product associated with this product (URL or DOI)

frequencyA.listOfPolarizations: List of processed polarization layers with frequency A
frequencyA.centerFrequency: Center frequency of the processed image in hertz

pixelOffsets.mask: Combination of water mask and a mask of subswaths of valid samples in the reference RSLC and geometrically-coregistered secondary RSLC. Each pixel value is a three-digit number: the most significant digit represents the water flag of that pixel the reference RSLC, where 1 is water and 0 is non-water; the second digit represents the subswath number of that pixel in the reference RSLC; the least significant digit represents the subswath number of that pixel in the secondary RSLC. A value of 0 in either subswath digit indicates an invalid sample in the corresponding RSLC
pixelOffsets.projection: Product map grid projection: EPSG code, with additional projection information as HDF5 Attributes
pixelOffsets.yCoordinateSpacing: Nominal spacing in meters between consecutive lines
pixelOffsets.xCoordinateSpacing: Nominal spacing in meters between consecutive pixels

layer1.projection: Product map grid projection: EPSG code, with additional projection information as HDF5 Attributes
layer1.yCoordinateSpacing: Nominal spacing in meters between consecutive lines
layer1.xCoordinateSpacing: Nominal spacing in meters between consecutive pixels
layer1.slantRangeOffset: Raw (unculled, unfiltered) slant range pixel offsets
layer1.crossOffsetVariance: Off-diagonal term of the pixel offsets covariance matrix

layer2.projection: Product map grid projection: EPSG code, with additional projection information as HDF5 Attributes
layer2.yCoordinateSpacing: Nominal spacing in meters between consecutive lines
layer2.xCoordinateSpacing: Nominal spacing in meters between consecutive pixels
layer2.slantRangeOffset: Raw (unculled, unfiltered) slant range pixel offsets
layer2.crossOffsetVariance: Off-diagonal term of the pixel offsets covariance matrix

layer3.projection: Product map grid projection: EPSG code, with additional projection information as HDF5 Attributes
layer3.yCoordinateSpacing: Nominal spacing in meters between consecutive lines
layer3.xCoordinateSpacing: Nominal spacing in meters between consecutive pixels
layer3.slantRangeOffset: Raw (unculled, unfiltered) slant range pixel offsets
layer3.crossOffsetVariance: Off-diagonal term of the pixel offsets covariance matrix

layer1.projection: Product map grid projection: EPSG code, with additional projection information as HDF5 Attributes
layer1.yCoordinateSpacing: Nominal spacing in meters between consecutive lines
layer1.xCoordinateSpacing: Nominal spacing in meters between consecutive pixels
layer1.slantRangeOffset: Raw (unculled, unfiltered) slant range pixel offsets
layer1.crossOffsetVariance: Off-diagonal term of the pixel offsets covariance matrix
layer1.snr: Pixel offsets signal to noise ratio

layer2.projection: Product map grid projection: EPSG code, with additional projection information as HDF5 Attributes
layer2.yCoordinateSpacing: Nominal spacing in meters between consecutive lines
layer2.xCoordinateSpacing: Nominal spacing in meters between consecutive pixels
layer2.slantRangeOffset: Raw (unculled, unfiltered) slant range pixel offsets
layer2.crossOffsetVariance: Off-diagonal term of the pixel offsets covariance matrix

layer3.projection: Product map grid projection: EPSG code, with additional projection information as HDF5 Attributes
layer3.yCoordinateSpacing: Nominal spacing in meters between consecutive lines
layer3.xCoordinateSpacing: Nominal spacing in meters between consecutive pixels
layer3.slantRangeOffset: Raw (unculled, unfiltered) slant range pixel offsets
layer3.crossOffsetVariance: Off-diagonal term of the pixel offsets covariance matrix

parameters.runConfigurationContents: Contents of the run configuration file with parameters used for processing

reference.referenceTerrainHeight: Reference terrain height as a function of map coordinates for reference RSLC
reference.rfiMitigationApplied: Flag to indicate if radio frequency interference (RFI) mitigation was applied during the generation of the reference RSLC
reference.rfiMitigation: Algorithm used for radio frequency interference (RFI) mitigation in the reference RSLC, either "ST-EVD" or "FDNF" (or "disabled" if no RFI mitigation was applied)
reference.isMixedMode: "True" if reference RSLC is a composite of data collected in multiple radar modes, "False" otherwise

frequencyA.slantRangeStart: Slant range start distance for the reference RSLC
frequencyA.numberOfRangeSamples: Number of slant range samples for each azimuth line within the reference RSLC
frequencyA.numberOfAzimuthLines: Number of azimuth lines within the reference RSLC
frequencyA.slantRangeSpacing: Slant range spacing of reference RSLC
frequencyA.zeroDopplerTimeSpacing: Time interval in the along-track direction for reference RSLC raster layers
frequencyA.zeroDopplerStartTime: Azimuth start time (in UTC) of the reference RSLC product in the format YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.sssssssss
frequencyA.zeroDopplerEndTime: Azimuth stop time (in UTC) of the reference RSLC product in the format YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.sssssssss
frequencyA.rangeBandwidth: Processed slant range bandwidth for reference RSLC
frequencyA.azimuthBandwidth: Processed azimuth bandwidth for reference RSLC
frequencyA.dopplerCentroid: 2D LUT of Doppler centroid for frequency A

secondary.rfiMitigationApplied: Flag to indicate if radio frequency interference (RFI) mitigation was applied during the generation of the secondary RSLC
secondary.rfiMitigation: Algorithm used for radio frequency interference (RFI) mitigation in the secondary RSLC, either "ST-EVD" or "FDNF" (or "disabled" if no RFI mitigation was applied)
secondary.isMixedMode: "True" if secondary RSLC is a composite of data collected in multiple radar modes, "False" otherwise
secondary.referenceTerrainHeight: Reference terrain height as a function of map coordinates for secondary RSLC

frequencyA.dopplerCentroid: 2D LUT of Doppler centroid for frequency A
frequencyA.slantRangeStart: Slant range start distance for the secondary RSLC
frequencyA.numberOfRangeSamples: Number of slant range samples for each azimuth line within the secondary RSLC
frequencyA.numberOfAzimuthLines: Number of azimuth lines within the secondary RSLC
frequencyA.slantRangeSpacing: Slant range spacing of secondary RSLC
frequencyA.zeroDopplerTimeSpacing: Time interval in the along-track direction for secondary RSLC raster layers
frequencyA.zeroDopplerStartTime: Azimuth start time (in UTC) of the secondary RSLC product in the format YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.sssssssss
frequencyA.zeroDopplerEndTime: Azimuth stop time (in UTC) of the secondary RSLC product in the format YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS.sssssssss
frequencyA.rangeBandwidth: Processed slant range bandwidth for secondary RSLC
frequencyA.azimuthBandwidth: Processed azimuth bandwidth for secondary RSLC

frequencyA.dopplerCentroid: 2D LUT of common Doppler centroid between reference and secondary RSLCs
frequencyA.dopplerBandwidth: Common Doppler bandwidth between reference and secondary RSLCs

frequencyA.rangeBandwidth: Processed slant range bandwidth for frequency A pixel offsets layers
frequencyA.azimuthBandwidth: Processed azimuth bandwidth for frequency A pixel offsets layers
frequencyA.correlationSurfaceOversampling: Oversampling factor of the cross-correlation surface
frequencyA.margin: Margin in pixels around reference RSLC edges excluded during cross-correlation computation
frequencyA.slantRangeStartPixel: Reference RSLC start pixel in slant range
frequencyA.alongTrackStartPixel: Reference RSLC start pixel in along-track
frequencyA.slantRangeSkipWindowSize: Slant range cross-correlation skip window size in pixels
frequencyA.alongTrackSkipWindowSize: Along-track cross-correlation skip window size in pixels

layer1.alongTrackWindowSize: Along-track cross-correlation window size in pixels
layer1.slantRangeWindowSize: Slant range cross-correlation window size in pixels
layer1.alongTrackSearchWindowSize: Along-track cross-correlation search window size in pixels
layer1.slantRangeSearchWindowSize: Slant range cross-correlation search window size in pixels

layer2.alongTrackWindowSize: Along-track cross-correlation window size in pixels
layer2.slantRangeWindowSize: Slant range cross-correlation window size in pixels
layer2.alongTrackSearchWindowSize: Along-track cross-correlation search window size in pixels
layer2.slantRangeSearchWindowSize: Slant range cross-correlation search window size in pixels

layer3.alongTrackWindowSize: Along-track cross-correlation window size in pixels
layer3.slantRangeWindowSize: Slant range cross-correlation window size in pixels
layer3.alongTrackSearchWindowSize: Along-track cross-correlation search window size in pixels
layer3.slantRangeSearchWindowSize: Slant range cross-correlation search window size in pixels

geocoding.rangeIonosphericCorrectionApplied: Flag to indicate if the range ionospheric correction is applied to improve geolocation
geocoding.azimuthIonosphericCorrectionApplied: Flag to indicate if the azimuth ionospheric correction is applied to improve geolocation
geocoding.hydrostaticTroposphericCorrectionApplied: Flag to indicate if the hydrostatic tropospheric correction is applied to improve geolocation
geocoding.wetTroposphericCorrectionApplied: Flag to indicate if the wet tropospheric correction is applied to improve geolocation

geocoding.complexGeocodingInterpolation: Geocoding interpolation algorithm for complex-valued datasets
geocoding.integerGeocodingInterpolation: Geocoding interpolation algorithm for integer datasets
geocoding.floatingGeocodingInterpolation: Geocoding interpolation algorithm for floating point datasets

inputs.l1ReferenceSlcGranules: List of input reference L1 RSLC products used
inputs.l1SecondarySlcGranules: List of input secondary L1 RSLC products used
inputs.orbitFiles: List of input orbit files used
inputs.configFiles: List of input config files used
inputs.demSource: Description of the input digital elevation model (DEM)
inputs.waterMaskSource: Description of the input water mask

orbit.temporalBaseline: Time interval between reference and secondary RSLCs

reference.time: Time vector record. This record contains the time since UTC epoch corresponding to position and velocity records
reference.position: Position vector record. This record contains the platform position data with respect to WGS84 G1762 reference frame
reference.velocity: Velocity vector record. This record contains the platform velocity data with respect to WGS84 G1762 reference frame
reference.orbitType: Orbit product type, either "FOE", "NOE", "MOE", "POE", or "Custom", where "FOE" stands for Forecast Orbit Ephemeris, "NOE" is Near real-time Orbit Ephemeris, "MOE" is Medium precision Orbit Ephemeris, and "POE" is Precise Orbit Ephemeris

secondary.time: Time vector record. This record contains the time since UTC epoch corresponding to position and velocity records
secondary.position: Position vector record. This record contains the platform position data with respect to WGS84 G1762 reference frame
secondary.velocity: Velocity vector record. This record contains the platform velocity data with respect to WGS84 G1762 reference frame
secondary.orbitType: Orbit product type, either "FOE", "NOE", "MOE", "POE", or "Custom", where "FOE" stands for Forecast Orbit Ephemeris, "NOE" is Near real-time Orbit Ephemeris, "MOE" is Medium precision Orbit Ephemeris, and "POE" is Precise Orbit Ephemeris

reference.time: Time vector record. This record contains the time since UTC epoch corresponding to attitude and quaternion records
reference.attitudeType: Attitude type, either "FRP", "NRP", "PRP, or "Custom", where "FRP" stands for Forecast Radar Pointing, "NRP" is Near Real-time Pointing, and "PRP" is Precise Radar Pointing

secondary.time: Time vector record. This record contains the time since UTC epoch corresponding to attitude and quaternion records
secondary.attitudeType: Attitude type, either "FRP", "NRP", "PRP, or "Custom", where "FRP" stands for Forecast Radar Pointing, "NRP" is Near Real-time Pointing, and "PRP" is Precise Radar Pointing

radarGrid.referenceSlantRange: Slant range of the reference RSLC in meters
radarGrid.referenceZeroDopplerAzimuthTime: Zero Doppler azimuth time in seconds since UTC epoch of the reference RSLC image
radarGrid.incidenceAngle: Incidence angle is defined as the angle between the LOS vector and the normal to the ellipsoid at the target height
radarGrid.losUnitVectorX: East component of the line-of-sight (LOS) unit vector, defined from the target to the sensor, expressed in the east-north-up (ENU) coordinate system with its origin at the target location
radarGrid.losUnitVectorY: North component of the line-of-sight (LOS) unit vector, defined from the target to the sensor, expressed in the east-north-up (ENU) coordinate system with its origin at the target location
radarGrid.alongTrackUnitVectorX: East component of the along-track unit vector at the target location, expressed in the east-north-up (ENU) coordinate system and projected onto the horizontal plane (i.e., excluding the up component)
radarGrid.alongTrackUnitVectorY: North component of the along-track unit vector at the target location, expressed in the east-north-up (ENU) coordinate system and projected onto the horizontal plane (i.e., excluding the up component)
radarGrid.elevationAngle: Elevation angle is defined as the angle between the LOS vector and the normal to the ellipsoid at the sensor
radarGrid.groundTrackVelocity: Absolute value of the platform velocity scaled at the target height
radarGrid.secondaryZeroDopplerAzimuthTime: Zero Doppler azimuth time in seconds since UTC epoch of the secondary RSLC image
radarGrid.secondarySlantRange: Slant range of the secondary RSLC in meters
radarGrid.parallelBaseline: Parallel component of the InSAR baseline
radarGrid.perpendicularBaseline: Perpendicular component of the InSAR baseline
radarGrid.projection: Product map grid projection: EPSG code, with additional projection information as HDF5 Attributes
radarGrid.heightAboveEllipsoid: Height values above WGS84 Ellipsoid corresponding to the radar grid
